text: ahh that is much easier! Thanks

_Can't remember if we chatted on this..._ For Dynamic Pages - Is it possible to assign a different template to the details (subpage) page? I know currently, whatever page template the HubDB code is on is also used for the details (subpage) pages. Wasnt sure if this can be controlled without having to custom code an entire template to make it work

Oh that’s a good question… If you can’t then yeah… I’m thinking about the level of custom coding you’d have to do on your hubl to sort out those subpages and then show or hide one chunk of HTML vs another depending on if it’s the main page or a sub page (reminds me of blog layouts… listing vs detail)
But with BLogs you CAN use a different template… so it would only make sense to have this function similiarly
ajlaporte: I've seperate the logic "and layouts" for better UI, but use similar logic to how HubSpot does the blog listing/post.
You could also make it so that you have an "if/then" around the drag and drop modules in the css areas that showcase a group of modules.
Do you have an example of these that you mention?
<@U25C65C3S> for the separation, did you use a custom coded template or one with the builder?
ah ok, so this isnt using Dynamic pages right? Just HubDB
I've done it with dynamic also, just have the container for the loop around the whole Group of the page that displays
just shared the image in the channel

About what I expected you’d have to do - at least until they release some form of select field (to choose the template for the detail page) similar to how you choose the HubDB Table that the dynamic page is based on. For now I guess you’ll just be creating a single template and changing up the wrapping or custom HubL modules as <@U25C65C3S> described
